caption:
The photograph captures a vivid and rustic scene of a stilt-supported waterfront community, likely a fishing village. It features two main wooden structures, standing on stilts above calm water. These buildings appear weather-beaten, with peeling paint and patches on the siding, indicating they have withstood various environmental elements.

Each building has a porch and the one on the right has clothes hanging on a line, suggesting daily life and habitation. A series of wooden walkways connects these structures, allowing for movement between them over the water. The focus of the image involves several individuals: one person walking towards one of the buildings on the wooden dock, and a few others appear in varied positions along these walkways and porches, contributing a sense of community and activity.

In the foreground, large rocks jut out into the water, adding texture to the scene. The background is a flat horizon of lush green marshland under a sky scattered with clouds, emphasizing the setting's remote and natural environment.

Overall, the image exudes a sense of isolation and simplicity of life, tied closely to the water and dependent on the sturdiness of these wooden structures in a remote locale.
title: Fishing camps, at goose point
